page.title: 01Loch Slapin and Suisnish
page.content: All of this block with the exception of one twelfth of Sea Loch Slapin Suisnish headland is a derelict crofting area, mostly empty of habitation since the last century, the last resident left about 20 years ago. The surviving croft house in square 3 is used by the crofter/shepherd at lambing time. The remainder of the buildings have fallen into disrepair with the exception of the sheep pen and a storage shed. There is a rough track leading to Suisnish Township from the road but this is only suitable for a Land Rover, it turns into a footpath along the cliffs in square 4 and is very popular with summer visitors. The land is now uncultivated grassland and moorland with a rocky coastline and cliffs. Suitable only for sheep grazing and bird watching
